intro: Quinquelocularia crispa, commonly known as the crinkled quinquelocular, is a unique species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate, lacey appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its botanical interest lies in its complex leaf structure and historical use in traditional medicine.
